item.title: Urgent - Hazardous Trees at Bracklyn Court (41-80), 17th August
item.description:
The trees have not been pruned for over five years, and this neglect is creating several safety hazards. We have had multiple incidents of large, dead branches falling into private gardens, where young children and elderly residents live. Additionally, th

item.title: Traffic lights facing wrong direction, 17th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 136, Herbert Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Wedderburn road < Lyndhurst Gardens < Belsize lane, 17th August
item.description:
The junction on wedderburn road and Lyndhurst gardens is extremely dangerous: As there is no stop sign on either side of Wedderburn road and Belsize lane opposite; drivers do not know to stop for cars driving up Lyndhurst gardens. There is even no road marking on Belsize lane so drivers crossing over to Wedderburn road don’t even know to stop. I think it would be extremely beneficial and save lives to have a stop sign on both sides of the road: Wedderburn road and Belsize lane. As right now, it looks like a straight road with junction. Hope this makes sense. Happy to provide more information - I think it’s imperative
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2a, Wedderburn Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking bay, 17th August
item.description:
This car was parked in Abbotts Close approximately 6 weeks ago, it has no MOT, it does not belong to anyone that resides in Abbotts Close or Slocum Close. It is taking up a parking space which is needed as it can be hard to find a space in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotts Close, Thamesmead, London
